metadata.title: CVE-2020-27066 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In xfrm6_tunnel_free_spi of net/ipv6/xfrm6_tunnel.c, there is a possibleuse after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalationof privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction isnot needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroidID: A-168043318

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27066` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
